::: {.cell}

:::


This is an example of attempting a tidy Tuesday challenge for May 2nd, 2023.

The data for this challenge is available at:

<https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2023/2023-05-02/readme.md>





## load libraries





## load data using the tidytuesdayR package


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2023-05-02')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
--- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2023-05-02 ----
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
--- There are 3 files available ---
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
--- Starting Download ---
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Downloading file 1 of 3: `plots.csv`
	Downloading file 2 of 3: `species.csv`
	Downloading file 3 of 3: `surveys.csv`
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
--- Download complete ---
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plots <- tuesdata$plots
species <- tuesdata$species
surveys <- tuesdata$surveys
```
:::


## Mice per year


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
mice_count_by_year <- surveys %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  count()

ggplot(mice_count_by_year, aes(x= year, y=n))+
  geom_line() +
  geom_point()+
  ggtitle("Mice count by year")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Week_12_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Mice per year by sex


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
mice_count_by_year_sex <- surveys %>%
  group_by(year,sex) %>%
  count()

ggplot(mice_count_by_year_sex, aes(x= year, y=n, color=sex))+
  geom_line() +
  ggtitle("Mice count by year and sex")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Week_12_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Mice per year by species


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
mice_count_by_year_species <- surveys %>%
  group_by(year,species) %>%
  count()

ggplot(mice_count_by_year_species, aes(x= year, 
                                       y=n, 
                                       color=species,
                                       shape= species))+
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  ggtitle("Mice count by year and species")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: The shape palette can deal with a maximum of 6 discrete values because
more than 6 becomes difficult to discriminate; you have 20. Consider
specifying shapes manually if you must have them.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Removed 321 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Week_12_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
ggplot(mice_count_by_year_species, aes(x= year, 
                                       y=n, 
                                       color=species))+
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  ggtitle("Mice count by year and species")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1980,2020,5)) +
  facet_wrap(~species)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Week_12_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Pregnancy by month


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
monthly_data <- surveys %>%
  mutate(month_string = lubridate::month(censusdate,label= T)) %>%
  group_by(month) %>%
  count(pregnant) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=pregnant, values_from = n) %>%
  mutate(proportion_pregnant = P/(P+`NA`))

ggplot(monthly_data, aes(x=month, y=proportion_pregnant))+
  geom_line()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Week_12_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## bob ross


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2023-02-21')
```


```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true"}
#tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2023, week = 8)

bob_ross <- tuesdata$bob_ross
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(bob_ross, aes(x=num_colors))+
  geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Week_12_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bob_ross_longer <- bob_ross %>%
  pivot_longer(10:27) %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  summarize(count = sum(value))
```
:::
